Damnatio ad Bestias

By Galen Beebe, Karim Hajj, Gabe Isman, and John West
In 1974, the Supreme Court ruled that capital punishment was not unconstitutional, and the death penalty, which had been paused for a decade, was implemented again in 26 states.
Here are the names of every person executed since that Supreme Court ruling. We have highlighted some names, and there are a series of interludes throughout.

interlude

last words

final statements from the condemned in texas

Texas keeps a database of the last words of its condemned. The following are the top fifty most common words for their final statments. Clicking on each bubble brings up a representative statement in full.
Some of the statments are angry; some are remorseful. All of them are humanizing.
